Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: DISTILLATION FRACTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique observationnumber for the fractional distillation. This numbering can be used to keep track whathappened throughout the distillation and can help in result analysis.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CALCULATED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that the value given wascalculated, rather than measured. If the REPORTED_IND is also set to Y, thecalculated value was provided by the source (usually the lab) and not calculatedlater. For moredetails about how the value was calculated, refer to theCALCULATE_METHOD_ID column and foreign key.
Column Comment.5: CALCULATION METHOD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the method or formulaused to create a calculated or derived value.
Column Comment.6: DISTILLATION TEMPERATURE: The temperature at which the distillation of the oilis taking place.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: PROBLEM INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not there is a problem withthe step. If a yes flag is indicated, additional information regarding the problemshould be noted in the table ANL_PROBLEM.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: REPORTED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this value is provided as reportedby the source, usually a laboratory. This indicates that the value was not created ormodified upon load into PPDM, even though the value may not be correct. Ifproblems are suspected, set PROBLEM_IND to Y, and for more details about whatproblems may exist, refer to the ANL_PROBLEM table.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the preparation and processing of the sample. This column is asufficient method to keep track of what is done in the sample analysis. However, ifthe requirement for more complicated tracking such as two steps occurringsimultaneously or if steps are needed to be added to the initial procedure, use thetwo columns STEP_SEQ_NO1 and STEP_SEQ_NO2 in the tableANL_STEP_XREF.
Column Comment.16: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.17: VOLUME FRACTION DISTILLED: The volume of the oil that was fractional distilledfrom the crude mixture.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
